6.definition: hard structures in the mouth used for biting and chewing (dientes)
the color of snow or milk (blanco)
items worn to cover the body (ropa)
a garment for the upper body (camisa)
the color of a lemon or the sun (amarillo)
a garment for the lower body (pantalones)
the color of chocolate or wood (marrón)
a breakfast food made from grain (cereal)

7.definition: to stop sleeping and become conscious (despertar)
a reflective surface that shows an image (espejo)
a device for washing the body with water (ducha)
to take hold of something suddenly (agarrar)
a tool used for shaving hair (navaja)
the act of removing hair with a razor (afeitar)
to cause a sharp, temporary pain (arder)

8.definition: people with whom one has a bond of mutual affection (amigos)
engaging in an activity for enjoyment (jugando)
a sport played with a round ball and goals (fútbol)
a local area where people live (vecindario)
an open area of land for playing sports (campo)
a round object used in games and sports (balón)
a public road in a city or town (calle)
the place where two streets meet (esquina)

9.definition: a special outfit for work or school (uniforme)
a specific job to be done (tarea)
a flat surface for business transactions (mostrador)
a machine for recording sales and handling money (caja registradora)
a device used to read barcodes (escáner)
a person who works with someone (compañero de trabajo)
a request for goods or services (pedido)

10.definition: having difficulty dealing with a problem (luchando, teniendo dificultades)
a building where goods are manufactured (fábrica)
a place where vehicles are repaired or stored (garaje, taller)
achieving a goal or having wealth and recognition (exitoso)
causing admiration due to size, quality, or skill (impresionante)
a decorative hanging light with branches (candelabro, lámpara de araña)
the top inside surface of a room (techo, cielo raso)
to add things to make a place more attractive (decorar)
a room with a toilet and sink, sometimes a shower (baño)
to pause before saying or doing something (dudar, vacilar)
to move the head up and down to show agreement (asentir con la cabeza)
a small case for carrying money and cards (billetera, cartera)
to physically express happiness by jumping (saltar de emoción)
to experience sadness or guilt (sentirse mal)

11.definition: a school for students in grades 9–12 (preparatoria)
a neighborhood, especially in a Spanish-speaking community (barrio)
the style in which someone's hair is cut (corte de pelo)
confident and striking; not afraid to stand out (audaz)
a place where men get haircuts and shaves (barbería)
a tool used for cutting hair (máquina de cortar pelo)
a sharp tool used for shaving (navaja)
smiled in a smug or knowing way (sonrió con superioridad)
a haircut where hair gradually shortens toward the neck (degrade)
the image seen in a mirror (reflejo)
appearing stronger or more resilient (más duro)
a person who oversees music recording (productor musical)
posing for photos or videos as a model (modelaje)
a short film accompanying a song (videoclip)
